title: Failure to `install` in environments with external intel

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
Including an external intel compiler as part of a Spack environment prevents installation of that environment. I think it's because external codes don't get linked into a Spack view.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

With environment file `test.yaml`:
```yaml
spack:
  specs:
    - intel@18.0.2
  view: true
```

```console
$ spack env create test ./test.yaml
==> Updating view at /projects/spack/var/spack/environments/test/.spack-env/view
==> Created environment 'test' in /projects/spack/var/spack/environments/test
$ spack env activate test
$ spack concretize
==> Concretized intel@18.0.2
[+]  i4xujzv  intel@18.0.2%gcc@8.3.0 auto_dispatch=none +rpath arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64
==> Updating view at /projects/spack/var/spack/environments/test/.spack-env/view
==> Warning: [/projects/spack/var/spack/environments/test/.spack-env/view] Skipping external package: intel@18.0.2%gcc@8.3.0 auto_dispatch=none +rpath arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64/i4xujzv
```

Then try installing:

### Error Message

```console
$ spack install
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/projects/spack/bin/spack", line 64, in <module>
    sys.exit(spack.main.main())
  File "/projects/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 693, in main
    ev.activate(env, args.use_env_repo)
  File "/projects/spack/lib/spack/spack/environment.py", line 163, in activate
    cmds += env.add_default_view_to_shell(shell)
  File "/projects/spack/lib/spack/spack/environment.py", line 1107, in add_default_view_to_shell
    spec, self.default_view))
  File "/projects/spack/lib/spack/spack/user_environment.py", line 89, in environment_modifications_for_spec
    spec.package.setup_run_environment(env)
  File "/projects/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/intel.py", line 1018, in setup_run_environment
    env.extend(EnvironmentModifications.from_sourcing_file(f, *args))
  File "/projects/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/environment.py", line 587, in from_sourcing_file
    raise RuntimeError(msg)
RuntimeError: Trying to source non-existing file: /projects/spack/var/spack/environments/test/.spack-env/view/compilers_and_libraries/linux/bin/compilervars.sh
```

### Information on your system

relevant section  of `etc/spack/packages.yaml`:
```yaml
packages:
  intel:
    paths:
      intel@18.0.2: /opt/intel-2018
    buildable: False
```
